newsitem.title: CANADA: Ontario lowers 96/97 deficit target to C$8.173 bln.
newsitem.headline: Ontario lowers 96/97 deficit target to C$8.173 bln.

text.p: The Ontario government on Tuesday said it was lowering its deficit target for fiscal 1996/97 by C$7.0 million to C$8.173 billion from the C$8.18 billion target set out in the 1996 budget.
Ontario Finance Minister Ernie Eves announced the revised deficit target as part of the province's fiscal update for the second quarter of the 1996/97.
The finance minister also released the second quarter economic accounts today, reflecting the province's economic performance between April and June.
"The province's gross domestic product grew at a 2.0 per cent annualized rate in the second quarter, which was faster than the national rate of 1.3 percent," Eves said in a statement.
Eves said that housing starts in Ontario were up 18.5 percent over the first nine months of 1996.
The finance minister also said there are 99,000 more people employed in Ontario today than there were one year ago, making up more than 70 percent of the net new jobs created in Canada over the year.
